You can not use this function in tutorial mode.
get data failed, please connect Internet and press OK.
The accuracy of the results may be affected due to the following reasons:
with another background or better lighting
with another background or better lighting
with another background or better lighting
with another background or better lighting
with another background or better lighting
Arm away from body at 45 degree
Open hand with fingers together and thumb extended, palms facing forward
Open hand with fingers together and thumb extended, palms facing forward
Standing erect with legs slightly apart and toes pointing at around 10 and 2 of the clock
Standing erect with legs slightly apart and toes pointing at around 10 and 2 of the clock
suitable clothing and with hair tied up
with another background or better lighting
with another background or better lighting or with hair tied up
with another background or better lighting
suitable clothing and with hair tied up
\u0020look to the front with open hands and two legs open around the shoulder width.
\u0020look straight with hands and feet closed.
Take photos in an environment with sufficient lighting and not too lousy background. Avoid background colour too similar to your clothing or the skin colour.

The accuracy of the results may be affected if your hair covers the back, the shoulder or your neck. For people with shoulder-length or longer hair, you are suggested to tie your hair for better results.
Open hand with fingers together and thumb extended, palms facing forward.
Wear normal and light clothing can improve the accuracy of your results. Try to avoid clothing cover too much of your shape. You are suggested to take off jackets or high heel shoes if any.
To better results, you are advised to have clothing where your neck is not covered.

Tap on the templates, and move to the correct locations for Head Top, Left Hand, Right Hand, Left Shoe and Right Shoe one by one. You can pinch to zoom in or zoom out for better view of the photo. You can also use the sliding bar on the right to scale up or scale down the templates if needed.

Tap on the templates, and move to the correct locations for Head Top plus Neck and Shoe one by one. You can pinch to zoom in or zoom out for better view of the photo. You can also use the sliding bar on the right to scale up or scale down templates if needed. Press flip button on the left if the image is not on the correct side.
‘Undo’ - cancel all adjustment and start again.
‘Front’ – switch to see and adjust part location on the front-view photo.
‘Side’ – switch to see and adjust part location on the side-view photo.
‘Next’ - confirm and move on to next step.
Tap and adjust the body centre line position if needed. The profile is shown in yellow if it is tight fit to the body and it is shown in red if the predicted profile may be affected by occlusion.

Tap and move the points, so as to edit the front body profile, improving accuracy due to occlusion by clothing. The profile is shown in yellow if it is tight fit to the body and it is shown in red if the predicted profile may be affected by occlusion.

Tap and move the points, so as to edit the side body profile, improving accuracy due to occlusion by clothing. The profile is shown in yellow if it is tight fit to the body and it is shown in red if the predicted profile may be affected by occlusion.
‘Undo’ - cancel all editing and start again.
‘Front’ – switch to see and edit profile on the front profile.
‘Side’ – switch to see and edit profile on the side profile.
‘Done’ - confirm and move on to next step.

Only your approximated weight is needed.
Weight is only used for measurement calculation. Your privacy is protected by Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (PDPO).
